content: BombTar
same thing we do every night, Pinky - try to take over the world
Concept

In a format full of comeback cards, losing is the best way to get ahead. And Electrode ex is by far the best way to get losing. Dark Tyranitar is brutally strong, this deck maxes out disruption and aims to stick one or two Tyranitar in play to take all 6 prizes from the back foot.
Always blow the ‘Trode
Things to watch out for

This deck hates to see Sceptile ex δ and Fighting-type attackers. Against Sceptile, try to set up a “Bite-Off” KO with an early “Spinning Tail”. Make sure to get both Holon FF & Fire energy attached to a Tyranitar when expecting Fighting-type attackers.
The Deck
Decklist on LimitlessTCG
Core Pokemon
3-3-3 Larvitar, Dark Pupitar, Dark Tyranitar

Searching Dark Tyranitar pieces is almost never an issue in this deck, but powering up said Tyranitars is. It takes an Electrode ex to sometimes power up even a single Dark Tyranitar, thusly the deck plays a thinner line 3-3-3 line as you won’t need more than 3 max per game.

Dark Tyranitar itself is a beast. At 120HP as a non-ex Pokemon, it doesn’t often go down in one hit. Grind is an insane attack for solid damage, overload a Tyranitar to sweep with Grind late game. Spinning Tail damage adds up quick and only costs a Scramble energy to use. Try trapping something in the active and using Spinning Tail to take KOs around it.

Dark Pupitar has uses in the mirror and against Stantler decks, hitting for relevant Fighting weakness and having a coin flip chance to inflict Paralysis. As Dark Pupitar gets the bonus effects from Darkness Energy and can have Scramble Energy attached, it can be a good attacker in low-risk spots if you haven’t managed to find a Tyranitar yet.
2-2 Voltorb, Electrode ex

“Extra Energy Bomb” just does it all. Handing your opponent two prize cards just to make them immediately shuffle those cards away and draw 4 with Rocket’s Admin, activating Pow! Hand Extension AND accelerating a whole bunch of energy into play?

That’s a good card. Always try to use one Electrode ex per game, even if it only accelerates two energy. Using both is reserved for those mirror games and tight spots where you need to be “losing” to take the win.
2 Jirachi

The deck sets up behind a Jirachi. Get an energy on Jirachi and use “Make a Wish” to evolve your Dark Tyranitars and Electrode ex into play. You should only need one Jirachi per game but it is very important you get it early.
1 Lapras

Modern Players will recognise Lapras as Lumineon V, Lapras searches Rocket’s Admin for key combo turns or can be searched off Holon’s Mentor early when you are bricking. Lapras also will die to your own Cursed Stone, which you can use to your advantage to manipulate the prize trade.
The glue holding Bombtar together
1 Holon’s Voltorb
This Voltorb cannot evolve into Electrode ex, and is in the deck to function as a searchable energy card, for those moments when you need to search out an Energy for Jirachi.
Trainers
Holon Engine & Setup

Bombtar really wants to get its basic Pokemon on board and start evolving with Jirachi ASAP, so a combination of 4 Holon’s Transceiver, 4 Holon Mentor and Lapras is nine outs to getting Pokemon on board turn one.
Further Transceivers can be used as Mentor to search out more Larvitar and Lapras, or as Scientist/Adventurer to draw.
Typical Holon Mentor targets
The deck also plays 3 Steven’s Advice, a powerful draw Supporter for both setup turns and late game swing turns.
Disruption
Important to keep in mind that this deck plays NO RECOVERY CARDS.
The disruption core is 16 cards!

4 Rocket’s Admin for a disruption heavy deck, use one or two if you have to to draw out of a bad hand early, this card in the midgame is a combo piece to brick your opponent when using “Extra Energy Bomb”.

4 Pow! Hand Extension either brings up a Pokemon to the Active spot or moves an Energy off the Pokemon already in the Active spot to a Pokemon of your choosing. Abusing this card is the decks modus operandi, move energy around to trap Pokemon, pull up threats off the bench and do both in tandem to KO threats and simultaneously remove Energy from your opponent’s board.

4 Cessation Crystal prevent all Pokemon from using Poke-Powers and Poke-Bodies, so long as the Pokemon with Cessation Crystal is in the Active spot. It slows down the opponent, and limits their plays and, especially when paired with a good Rocket’s Admin, can totally brick your opponent whilst you whittle all their Pokemon down with “Spinning Tail”. Try not to attach multiple Cessation Crystal at once for fear of Windstorm discarding them all.

2 Cursed Stone do 10 damage to each Pokemon with a Poke-Power, between turns. In addition to effectively being +10 damage in a pinch, Cursed Stone can add up! Try to play them after your opponent has played most of their Windstorms to stick it in play for longer.
1 Warp Point both push and pull, this card can get you into Jirachi turn 1 and has use cases for moving your opponent’s Active Pokemon out the way.

1 Windstorm is played in the deck to have an out to opposing Cessation Crystal preventing Electrode ex from being used. As you only need one turn to use Electrode, there is only one Windstorm in the deck.
Energy

Heavy on Energy Cards, BombTar wants to discard some early to put into play with “Extra Energy Bomb” but still have enough to make hand attachments each turn. Each type of Energy Card in this deck is strong in its own right.
Big o pile of Energy
4 Darkness Energy which give a +10 Damage boost to attacks from Dark type Pokemon for each attack. Stacks quickly with Grind, and allows you to use Spinning Tail and Bite Off.

4 Scramble Energy provide 3 Rainbow Energy when attached to a non-ex Evolved Pokemon, and you are losing in prizes. Powers up Dark Tyranitar super fast, just take care you don’t catch up and find yourself unable to attack!

2 Heal Energy when attached to non-ex Pokemon from hand, this card heals that Pokemon for 10 and removes any Special Conditions. Useful for dodging KOs and recovering from Stantler-inflicted Confusion.

2 Holon Energy FF, 2 Basic Fire Energy these two come as a pair, as when Holon Energy FF AND a basic Fire Energy are attached to the same Pokemon, that Pokemon has no weakness. This combo lets Dark Tyranitar avoid getting KOed by Regirock ex, and other fighting-type attackers it would otherwise struggle with.
